DOC.brief_title: Educational Programme Impact Serum Phosphate Control
DOC.detailed_description: Background : In Chronic Kidney Disease patient , crucial begin treatment soon possible order minimize complication-related risk . Encouraging patient adhere treatment plan great challenge health care professional . Objectives : The aim study evaluate impact nutrition educational programme hyperphosphatemia use transtheoretical model eat behavior . Subjects Methods : A prospective Interventional study conduct dialysis centre 180 stage 5D Chronic Kidney Disease patient exhibit phosphate serum level > 5.5 mg/dL . The educational intervention consist lecture group dynamic session perform dialysis session . Anthropometric ( weight , height , body mass index ) , clinical , demographic ( sex , age , time dialysis programme , literacy/schooling ) laboratory parameter ( phosphate serum level ) evaluate transtheoretical model eat behavior ( TMFB ) apply pre- post-intervention . Reduction phosphate serum level positive/negative behavioral change evaluate outcomes . Statistical Analyses carry order compare effect educational programme phosphate serum level behaviour change .
DOC.criteria: patient freely consent participate study age 18 year old gender phosphate serum level higher 5.5 mg/dl ( last 3 consecutive monthly measure ) patient consent participate study pregnant cognitive deficit mental diseases patient whose phosphate serum level low 5.5 mg/dl equal 5.5 mg/dl
